item.title: A counter-example for the exponentiation / adjoint of a function
item.description: The problem: Let $X$, $Y$, and $Z$ be topological spaces. Let $Y^X$ denote the space of all continuous functions $X\to Y$, with the compact-open topology generated by the elements of the sub-basis $W_{K,U} = \{\varphi \in Y^X : \varphi K \subset U\}$, where $K$ ranges over all compact subsets of $X$ and $U$ ranges over over all open subsets of $Y$. Finite intersections of $W_{K,U}$ are a basis for the C.
